question.title: EditText multi-line / enter key does not work with OpenGL NativeActivity
question.body:
Using both OnEditorActionListener, TextWatcher, and overriding key callbacks on everything I can think of, I'm able to pick up on typed text changes EXCEPT for ENTER key with the following code:

// Create edit text widget.
EditText editText = new EditText(activity);
editText.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
editText.setFocusable(true);
editText.setFocusableInTouchMode(true);

// Add to activity.
WindowManager.LayoutParams params = new WindowManager.LayoutParams();
params.width = WindowManager.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT;
params.height = WindowManager.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT;
activity.addContentView(editText, params);

// Show keyboard.
editText.requestFocus();
InputMethodManager imm = (InputMethodManager) activity.getSystemService(INPUT_METHOD_SERVICE);
imm.showSoftInput(editText, InputMethodManager.SHOW_IMPLICIT);

However, when I do the following (instead of activity.addContentView), multi-line suddenly works and enter key works just fine, but then OpenGL stops rendering new frames once it is displayed.

activity.getWindowManager().addView(editText, params);

Been on this problem for quite some time. If I can get help with getting multi-line to work in the first case or getting OpenGL to render anyway in the second case, either would solve my problem!
